title: Rank (differential topology)
summary: In mathematics, the rank of a differentiable map f : M → N {\displaystyle f:M\to N} between differentiable manifolds at a point p ∈ M {\displaystyle p\in M} is the rank of the derivative of f {\displaystyle f} at p {\displaystyle p} . Recall that the derivative of f {\displaystyle f} at p {\displaystyle p} is a linear map
